text: you want to never-ending quest for a
five ingredient recipe I know I am key
to a five ingredient recipe is making
sure that every ingredient counts and in
this recipe for steamed Cod with ginger
scallions and soy every ingredient
counts and adds so much flavor you're
not going to believe it so why don't you
give it a try you first want to start by
grating some ginger the most powerhouse
flavor of all I just love it because it
adds spiciness it adds an aromatic nasai
cannot be replaced I like to grate it on
one of these rasp graders if you have
one use that if not you can use a
regular grater okay two tablespoons of
ginger that's basically the only prep
for this that you need oh you want to
season your fish this is cod with salt
I'm going to season one side and then
when I put it in the pan I'll season the
other side three tablespoons rice
vinegar not the seasoned kind into my
pan a 1 a 2 a 3 2 tablespoons soy sauce
so this is the liquid and you're
steaming there's no fat in here which is
kind of great it's a very small amount
of liquid but it's sufficient to steam
all of this fish and then the 2
tablespoons of ginger goes in there and
then turn your stove high just stir it
around a tiny bit just to just
distribute the ginger fish goes in and
then season on the outside and then just
cover up your pan for about 6 minutes
just until the fish is cooked through
cut up some scallions you need 6
scallions I have seven should I use
seven I'm just gonna use seven take your
scallions cut them into three inch
lengths and then just thinly slice them
lengthwise sprinkle these scallions
right on top there so mild they barely
need to be cooked at all just two more
minutes and the whole dish is done that
cooked for a total of eight minutes
three fantastic five ingredient dinner
ten minutes or less you're done you're
